subject: Law
title: The US Constitution in Context
description: A 60-second lesson on The US Constitution in Context.

hook.text: In 1787, fifty-five men gathered in Philadelphia to fix a broken government. They built a new one instead.

buildup.text: The Articles of Confederation were too weak. States acted like separate countries with no central authority.

discovery.text: The new Constitution created a federal system: power shared between national and state governments.

twist.text: Many delegates refused to sign without a Bill of Rights. The compromise shaped the final document.

climax.text: It became the oldest written national constitution still in force todayâ€”over 230 years and counting.

punchline.text: A summer debate became the world's longest-running experiment in democracy.

quiz.question: What did the US Constitution replace?
